alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Clay; Jackson; Knox; Laurel; Leslie; Owsley; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 9:34PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Laurel, northwestern Knox, Owsley, northwestern Leslie, northwestern Perry, southeastern Jackson, southwestern Breathitt and Clay Counties through 1015 PM EST... At 934 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Nathanton to Lesbas to Dorthae. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Observed. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Manchester, Blackwater, Sturgeon, Taff, Fall Rock, Cane Creek, Herron, Bush, Grace and Fogertown around 940 PM EST. Booneville, Tedders, Knoxfork, Gibbs, Trixie, Chestnut Gap, Wild Cat, Eversole, Littleton and Ricetown around 945 PM EST. Mistletoe, Seth, House, Barcreek, Oneida, Bluehole, Sprule, Arnett, Park Valley and Cottongin around 950 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Morris Fork, Hector, Woollum, Spurlock, Valjean, Houston, Guerrant, Turkey, Jetts Creek, Brutus, Buckhorn, Peabody, Dalesburg, Canoe, Enline, Sebastian`s Branch, Goose Rock, Whoopflarea, Jacks Creek, Talbert, Jackson, Curt, Panco and Botto. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 6 and 37. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 29 and 32. U.S. Highway 25 East in Laurel County between mile markers 1 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Breathitt; Clay; Jackson; Knox; Laurel; Leslie; Owsley; Perry
